Core

Class ConnectFourModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • Core.ConnectFourModel

  • public class ConnectFourModel
extends java.lang.Object
    The main game for Connect Four. The board size is 6 * 7. The one who first have four consecutive marks(horizontal, vertical or diagonal) in the board will win. Support for 2-players playing at the same machine and playing with an AI.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Guang Yang

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ConnectFourModel getInstance()

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the game, draw the GUI.

      • step

        public void step(int column)
        Current player takes a step. If this step is valid, it will be marked on the board. And if current mode is playing with AI, this AI will take a step too.
        Parameters:
        column - the column current player wants to insert the mark.

      • modeSet

        public void modeSet(int selectedMode)
        Set the game mode. TWIN for 2-players playing at the same machine. COMP for playing with an AI.
        Parameters:
        selectedMode - the game mode

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset this game to begin a new game.

      • getState

        public int getState()
        Returns:
        current game state.

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        Returns:
        current turn count.

      • getPlayer

        public int getPlayer()
        Returns:
        current player id.

      • getWinState

        public int getWinState()
        Returns:
        current winning state if the game has ended, only used for test.

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Returns:
        current game board.
